#### 4.1 toStringvalueOf

```js
var aaa = {
    i: 10,
    valueOf: function() { 
        console.log('valueOf...')
        return this.i + 30
    },
    toString: function() { 
        console.log('toString...')
        return this.i + 10
    }
}
console.log(aaa > 20); // valueOf...  true
console.log('' + aaa);  //  valueOf...  40
console.log(++aaa); // valueOf...  41
//  console.log(++aaa) 
console.log(+aaa); //  valueOf...  40
//  console.log(++aaa)  aaa41
console.log(+aaa); // 41 valueOf()
console.log(aaa == 40) // valueOf... true

//  aaa41 41
console.log(aaa); // {i: 10, valueOf: , toString: f}
console.log(String(aaa)) // toString... 20
```

valueOftoString

#### 4.2 toString

```js
var bbb = {
    i: 10,
    toString: function() {
        console.log('toString...')
        return this.i + 10
    }
}
console.log(bbb > 20); // toString... false
console.log('' + bbb);  //  toString... 20
console.log(++bbb); // toString... 21
//  console.log(++bbb) 
console.log(+bbb); // toString... 20
//  console.log(++bbb)  bbb21
console.log(+bbb); // 21 valueOf()
console.log(bbb == 20) // toString... true

// 
console.log(bbb); // {i: 10, toString: } toString()valueOf()
console.log(String(bbb)) // toString... 20
```

Post.title: Diary
Post._content:
### 1. substr()  substring()

- substr

> stringObject.substr(startIndex[, length])

<!-- More -->

```js
var str = abcdefg'

str.substr(2)  // cdefg
str.substr(-1) => str.substr(6)  // fg
str.substr(6)  // '
str.substr(2,2)  // cd
str.substr(2,7)  // cdefg
str.substr(2,-1) // ''
```

- substring

> stringObject.substring(startIndex[, stop]) stop

```js
var str = abcdefg'

str.substring(2)  // cdefg
str.substring(2,4)  // cd
str.substring(2,9)  // cdefg
str.substring(-2) => str.substring(0)  // abcdefg
str.substring(2,-4) => str.substring(2,0) => str.substring(0,2)  // ab'
```

### 2. slice()  splice()

- slice

> stringObject.slice(startIndex[, stop])
> arrayObject.slice(startIndex[, stop])
> stop   

```js
var str = abcdefg

str.slice(2)  // cdefg'
str.slice(0)  // abcdefg
str.slice(-2) => str.slice(5)  // fg
str.slice(8)  //   
str.slice(2,4)  // cd
str.slice(2,6)  // cdef
str.slice(2,18)  // cdefg
str.slice(4,2)  //  
str.slice(4,-1) => str.slice(4,6)  // ef

// 
```

- splice

> arrayObject.splice(startIndex, length[, item1, item2])
> splice  

```js
var arr = [a,b,c,d,e,f,g]

arr.splice(2,0)  //  arr = [a,b,c,d,e,f,g]
arr.splice(2,8)  // arr = [a, b, c']
arr.splice(2,-5)  // arr  arr

arr.splice(8,2)  // arr  arr
arr.splice(2,2,'11',22')  // [a, b, 11, 22, e, f, g]  arr = [c, d']
```

### 3. 

- typeof

> typeof   ECMA-262 
>   typeof  

```js
typeof 23  // number
typeof '124'  // string
typeof true  // boolean
typeof undefined  // undefined
typeof {}  // object
typeof null  // object
typeof [1, 3, 8]  // object
typeof function fn () {}  // function
typeof (new Number(33))  // object
typeof (new String('hello'))  // object
```

 typeof  

- instanceof

> instance  :   __proto__    prototype     new    instance    window    iframe    instanceof  

```js
'123' instance String  // false

Number instanceof Number  // true

new String('hello') instance String  // true

new Number(33) instance Number  // true
```

- Object.prototype.toString

```js
Object.prototype.toString.call(33)  // [object Number]

Object.prototype.toString.call('hello')  // [object String]

Object.prototype.toString.call([])  // [object Array]

Object.prototype.toString.call({})  // [object Object]

Object.prototype.toString.call(true)  // [object Boolean]

Object.prototype.toString.call(null)  // [object null]

Object.prototype.toString.call(undefined)  // [object undefined]

Object.prototype.toString.call(function fn () {})  // [object Function]

Object.prototype.toString.call(new Number(33))   // [object Number] 
```

- constructor

> constructor  
> constructor  nullundefined

```js
(33).constructor == Number  // true

('hello'.constructor == String  // true

([]).constructor == Array  // true

({}).constructor == Object  // true

(true).constructor == Boolean  // true

(null).constructor == null  // TypeError: Cannot read property 'constructor' of null

(undefined).constructor == undefined  // TypeError: Cannot read property 'constructor' of undefined

var fn = function () {}
fn.constructor == Function  // true

var number = new Number(66)
number.constructor == Number  // true
number.constructor == Object  // false
```

- 

- Array.isArray()

### 4. ES5 Array Function

- forEach

> Array.forEach(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)
> `thisObj`  `window`

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].forEach( function (ele, index, arr) {
    console.log(ele, index, arr)
})
```

- map

> Array.map(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].map(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele * index  // [0, 2, 10, 24]
})
```

- filter

> Array.filter(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr),  Boolean 

```js
[0, 2, 5, 8].filter(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele  // [2, 5, 8]
})

[0, 2, 5, 1].filter(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele <= index  // [0, 1]
})
```

- some

> Array.some(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].some(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele > 5  // true (8 > 5)
})
```

- every

> Array.every(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].every(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele > 5  // false (1, 2, 5 5)
})
```

- indexOf

> Array.indexof(searchEle[, fromIndex])
>  `searchEle` 
> `searchEle` 
> `fromIndex`  0

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2)  // 1
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, '0')  // 1
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, 'f') => [1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, 0)  // 1
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, 2)  // -1
```

- lastIndexOf

> Array.lastIndexOf(searchEle[, fromIndex])
>  `indexOf` 
> `searchEle` 
> `fromIndex`  Array.length  Array.length - 1

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5)  // 4
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 4)  // 4
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 8) => [1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 4)  // 4
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 'f')  // -1
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 3)  // 2
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 1)  // -1
```

- reduce

> Array.reduce(callbackFn[, initValue])
> callbackFn(previous, current, index, arr)
> `previous` 
> `current` 
> `initValue` , 

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].reduce(function (preV, curV, index, arr) {
    return preV + curV
}, 10)  // 26
```

```js
// 
// 
preV = initValue = 10, curV = 1, index = 0

// 
preV = 10 + 1 = 11, curV = 2, index = 1

// 
preV = 11 + 2 = 13, curV = 5, index = 2

// 
preV = 13 + 5 = 18, curV = 8, index = 3

// 
preV = 18 + 8 = 26, curV = undefined ()
```

- reduceRight

>  `reduceRight` 
> Array.reduceRight(callbackFn[, initValue])
> callbackFn(previous, current, index, arr)
> `previous` 
> `current` 

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].reduceRight(function (preV, curV, index, arr) {
    if (index == 0) {
        return preV - curV
    }
    return preV + curV
}, 10)  // 24
```

```js
// 
// 
preV = initValue = 10, curV = 8, index = 3

// 
preV = 10 + 8 = 18, curV = 5, index = 2

// 
preV = 18 + 5 = 23, curV = 2, index = 1

// 
preV = 23 + 2 = 25, curV = 1, index = 0

// 
preV = 25 - 1 = 24, curV = undefined ()
```

```js
Object.prototype.toString.call(new Number(33))   // [object Number] 
```

> constructor  nullundefined

```js

([]).constructor == Array  // true

({}).constructor == Object  // true

(undefined).constructor == undefined  // TypeError: Cannot read property 'constructor' of undefined
```

- forEach

> Array.forEach(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)
> `thisObj`  `window`

```js

    console.log(ele, index, arr)
})
```

- map

> Array.map(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].map(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele * index  // [0, 2, 10, 24]
})
```

- filter

> Array.filter(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr),  Boolean 

```js
[0, 2, 5, 8].filter(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele  // [2, 5, 8]
})

[0, 2, 5, 1].filter(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele <= index  // [0, 1]
})
```

- some

> Array.some(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].some(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele > 5  // true (8 > 5)
})
```

- every

> Array.every(callbackFn[, thisObj])
> callbackFn (value, index, arr)

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].every(function (ele, index, arr) {
    return ele > 5  // false (1, 2, 5 5)
})
```

- indexOf

> Array.indexof(searchEle[, fromIndex])
>  `searchEle` 
> `searchEle` 
> `fromIndex`  0

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2)  // 1
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, '0')  // 1
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, 'f') => [1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, 0)  // 1
[1, 2, 5, 8].indexOf(2, 2)  // -1
```

- lastIndexOf

> Array.lastIndexOf(searchEle[, fromIndex])
>  `indexOf` 
> `searchEle` 
> `fromIndex`  Array.length  Array.length - 1

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5)  // 4
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 4)  // 4
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 8) => [1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 4)  // 4
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 'f')  // -1
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 3)  // 2
[1, 2, 5, 8, 5].lastIndexOf(5, 1)  // -1
```

- reduce

> Array.reduce(callbackFn[, initValue])
> callbackFn(previous, current, index, arr)
> `previous` 
> `current` 
> `initValue` , 

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].reduce(function (preV, curV, index, arr) {
    return preV + curV
}, 10)  // 26
```

```js
// 
// 
preV = initValue = 10, curV = 1, index = 0

// 
preV = 10 + 1 = 11, curV = 2, index = 1

// 
preV = 11 + 2 = 13, curV = 5, index = 2

// 
preV = 13 + 5 = 18, curV = 8, index = 3

// 
preV = 18 + 8 = 26, curV = undefined ()
```

- reduceRight

>  `reduceRight` 
> Array.reduceRight(callbackFn[, initValue])
> callbackFn(previous, current, index, arr)
> `previous` 
> `current` 

```js
[1, 2, 5, 8].reduceRight(function (preV, curV, index, arr) {
    if (index == 0) {
        return preV - curV
    }
    return preV + curV
}, 10)  // 24
```

```js
// 
// 
preV = initValue = 10, curV = 8, index = 3

// 
preV = 10 + 8 = 18, curV = 5, index = 2

// 
preV = 18 + 5 = 23, curV = 2, index = 1

// 
preV = 23 + 2 = 25, curV = 1, index = 0

// 
preV = 25 - 1 = 24, curV = undefined ()
```

Post.title: Web Worker
Post._content:
### 

> JavaScript  CPU 
> Web Worker  JavaScript  Worker Worker  Worker  Worker  UI 

### 

```js
    const worker = new Worker(jsUrl[, { name: 'yourWorkerName' }])
```

<!-- More -->

### Tips

*  `Worker` 
* `Worker`  `document``window``parent``alert()``confirm()` `console` `XMLHttpRequest`  `AJAX` 
*  `importScript`  `alert` 
* `Worker` `file://`

###  API

```js
    Worker.onerror():  error 
    Worker.onmessage():  message 
    Worker.onmessageerror():  messageerror 
    Worker.postMessage():  Worker 
    Worker.terminate():  Worker 
```

### Worker API

```js
    self.name: Worker 
    self.onmessage:  message 
    self.onmessageerror:  messageerror 
    self.close():  Worker 
    self.postMessage():  Worker 
    self.importScripts():  JS 
```

###

```js
console.log([10] == 10);                // true
console.log('10' == 10);                // true
console.log([] == 0);                   // true
console.log(true == 1);                 // true
console.log([] == false);               // true
console.log(![] == false);              // true
console.log([] == ![]);                 // true
console.log('' == 0);                   // true
console.log('' == false);               // true

console.log(null == true);              // false
console.log(!null == true);             // true
console.log(null == undefined);         // true
```

<!-- More -->

### 1. === (strict equality comparision)

```js
if (Type(x) !== Type(y))  return false
if (Type(x) === Type(y)) {
    if (Type(x) === Undefined) return true
    if (Type(x) === Null) return true
    if (Type(x) === String) {
        return  ? true : false
    }
    if (Type(x) === Boolean) {
        return xytruefalse ? true : false
    }
    if (Type(x) === Symbol) {
        return Symbol ? true : false
    }
    if (Type(x) === Number) {
        if (x === NaN) return false
        if (y === NaN) return false
        if (xy  x = 8, y = 8) return true
        if (x = 0, y = -0) return true
        if (x = -0, y = 0) return true
        return false  // false
    }
}
```

### 2. == (abstract equality comparision)

```js
if (Type(x) === Type(y)) return x === y
if (Type(x) !== Type(y)) {
    if (x === null && y === undefined) return true
    if (x === undefined && y === null) return true
    if (Type(x) === Number && Type(y) === String) return x == ToNumber(y)
    if (Type(x) === String && Type(y) === Number) return ToNumber(x) == y
    if (Type(x) === Boolean) return ToNumber(x) == y
    if (Type(y) === Boolean) return x == ToNumber(y)
    if ([String, Number, Symbol].includes(Type(x)) && Type(y) === Object) return x == ToPrimitive(y)
    if (Type(x) === Object && [String, Number, Symbol].includes(Type(y))) return ToPrimitive(x) == y
    return false  // false
}
```

- Type(x) x
- ToNumber(x) xNumber
- ToBoolean(x) xBoolean
- ToString(x) xString
- ToPrimitive(x) x
